It is a duty to society as a whole to deliver the answers the country deserves and needs.” mocracies and installed the 17- year dictatorship that imprisoned, tortured and killed thousands of its opponents, Chile has enacted a national search plan to track down the remaining disappeared.  street it was on: Simón Bolívar. It was little more than a house in a rural area east of the capital run by the regime’s intelligence agency, DINA. There were no witnesses or survivors to shed light on the detainees’ fates. For decades, there was only deafening silence. Mr. Ortíz was one of 1,469 people who disappeared under Chile’s military rule from 1973 to 1990. Only 307 of them have been found and identified. Now, before the 50th anniversary of the coup that toppled one of Latin America’s most stable deA rally in Santiago, Chile, for those who have disappeared.
image_1.description: The image depicts a man with curly hair, wearing a plaid shirt and earrings. He is holding a black-and-white photograph of a person named Lumi Videla Moya, as indicated by the text on the photo. The man appears to be participating in a rally or protest, as suggested by the context provided. He is also holding a red flower, which is placed above the photograph. The background is slightly blurred, but it appears to be an outdoor setting with other people and posters visible. The overall atmosphere conveys a sense of remembrance and solidarity.

image_2.context: KEATON BEACH, Fla. — Hurricane Idalia, the first major storm to pummel Florida this season, brought a surge of seawater on Wednesday that flooded neighborhoods along much of the state’s western coast and lacerating winds that cut power and leveled trees. Two people died in By PATRICIA MAZZEI and THOMAS FULLER State Spared Worst, but Now South Carolina Faces Danger TWO DIE DURING STORM HURRICANE SLAMSCOASTAL REGIONS IN WEST FLORIDA From top, damage in Florida from Hurricane Idalia, which was downgraded to a tropical storm by Wednesday evening: Horseshoe Beach; Cedar Key, a group of tiny islands; and Crystal River.  one that was long awaited and very welcome — can persist. The Fed’s preferred inflation measure, the Personal Consumption Expenditures index, is expected to tick up to 4.2 or 4.3 percent in a report on Thursday, after volatile food and fuel costs are stripped out. That would be an increase from 4.1 percent for the core measure in June. And while it would still be down considerably from a peak of 5.4 percent last summer, such a reading would underscore that inflation remains stubbornly above the Fed’s 2 percent goal and that its path back to normal is proving bumpy.
image_2.description: The image depicts a scene of destruction and devastation caused by Hurricane Idalia in Keaton Beach, Florida. A white pickup truck is partially submerged in water, tilted to one side, indicating the force of the floodwaters. The truck is located near a body of water, possibly a canal or a flooded area, with debris scattered around it. In the background, there is a stilt house elevated above the ground, which appears to have sustained some damage. The house has a deck with railings, and American flags are visible, suggesting a residential area. The surrounding area is littered with various pieces of debris, including what appears to be parts of structures and other materials. Palm trees and other vegetation are present, some of which appear damaged or uprooted due to the storm. The overall atmosphere conveys a sense of aftermath and destruction, with the landscape heavily impacted by the hurricane's surge and winds.

image_3.description: The image consists of two distinct scenes depicting the aftermath of Hurricane Idalia in Florida. The top image shows a flooded area with two buildings, each marked with numbers '14' and '15'. The building on the left has a yellow door and a window with a fish painting, while the building on the right has an orange door and a similar window. Both doors are partially submerged in water, indicating significant flooding. The surrounding area is also flooded, with vegetation emerging from the water. The bottom image depicts a flooded street lined with large trees covered in Spanish moss. The street is completely submerged, with only the tops of the trees and some road signs visible above the water. The overall atmosphere conveys the severity of the flood and its impact on the local environment.

The banks of the river are lined with dense evergreen trees, predominantly conifers, which tower above the water. The sky is visible in the background, showing a pale blue hue with no clouds, suggesting a clear day. The overall atmosphere of the image is tranquil and natural, evoking a sense of peace and untouched wilderness. The lighting suggests either early morning or late afternoon, as the light is soft and diffused, casting gentle shadows among the trees.

image_6.description: The image depicts a male tennis player walking outdoors, likely at the U.S. Open tennis tournament. He is carrying a large red duffel bag over his shoulder and is dressed in a white shirt and bright yellow shorts. The background features a hedge with the 'US Open' logo prominently displayed on it. The setting appears to be a parking lot or an outdoor area near the tennis courts, as indicated by the presence of a car and a parking sign. The atmosphere suggests a professional environment, possibly during a break or after a match. The player's posture and the way he carries his bag suggest he is either arriving at or leaving the venue.
